title.justification: This is the title of the paper as given at the beginning.

extractions.description: This paper proposes a novel manifold alignment method called MALI (Manifold Alignment with Label Information) that learns a correspondence between two distinct domains by leveraging the diffusion process and discrete class labels. It aims at finding a common representation for two domains and can be applied to domain adaptation problems. The method outperforms current state-of-the-art manifold alignment algorithms in multiple datasets.

type.justification: The paper performs experimental evaluations of the proposed method (MALI) across multiple datasets, comparing its performance with other state-of-the-art methods.
type.quote: We show via experimentation that MALI outperforms current state-of-the-art MA algorithms in this setting across multiple datasets by several metrics.

name.justification: The paper deals with learning correspondences and common representations between data from different domains which usually falls under the purview of multimodal learning.
name.quote: Multi-domain data is becoming increasingly common and presents both challenges and opportunities in the data science community. The integration of distinct data-views can be used for exploratory data analysis, and benefit downstream analysis including machine learning related tasks.

name.justification: The paper discusses the usage of MALI for domain adaptation problems, leveraging the learned inter-domain correspondences.
name.quote: Additionally, MALI can be used for the transfer learning problem known as domain adaptation.

name.justification: The core of the proposed method (MALI) is based on manifold alignment techniques, which are a subset of manifold learning.
name.quote: MALI learns the manifold structure in both domains via a diffusion process and then leverages discrete class labels to guide the alignment.

name.justification: The main model proposed in the paper is MALI.
name.quote: we present a novel manifold alignment method called MALI (Manifold alignment with label information) that learns a correspondence between two distinct domains.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces MALI as a new model for manifold alignment using label information.
is_contributed.quote: we present a novel manifold alignment method called MALI (Manifold alignment with label information).

is_executed.justification: The paper presents experimental results based on the implementation and execution of MALI on multiple datasets.
is_executed.quote: We show via experimentation that MALI outperforms current state-of-the-art MA algorithms in this setting across multiple datasets by several metrics.

is_compared.justification: MALI is compared with other state-of-the-art manifold alignment methods in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We now compare the performance of MALI with KEMArbf [31] and [35]...

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for MALI as it is introduced in this paper.

name.justification: MNIST-D is one of the datasets used for evaluating MALI.
name.quote: • MNIST-D: one domain consists of the original MNIST digits, while the other is generated by applying multiple transformations including rotation, downscaling, and Gaussian blurring (see Fig. 2).

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for MNIST-D as it is used within this paper.

name.justification: stl10 is one of the datasets used for evaluating MALI.
name.quote: • stl10: a popular dataset for computer vision, where the first domain contains the original images, and the second is generated by applying brightness, gray scaling, and Gaussian blurring.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for stl10 as it is used within this paper.

name.justification: RNA-ATAC is one of the datasets used for evaluating MALI.
name.quote: • RNA-ATAC: Jointly measured observations of single-cell RNA-seq and ATAC-seq data. The data is available at Multimodal Single-Cell Data Integration challenge, NeurIPS competition track 2021.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for RNA-ATAC as it is used within this paper.

name.justification: Helix is one of the datasets used for evaluating MALI.
name.quote: • Helix: two one-dimensional manifolds embedded in a 3D space plus noise, where one domain is a helix and the other a straight line.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for Helix as it is used within this paper.
